page.title: 02Community Centre in Ingleton
page.content: Mrs Coulthurst put much of the money towards the Centre. Mrs Coulthurst, from Gargrave opened the Centre on the 21st of September 1974.Ingleton paid for most of the Centre, not the County Council. To hire the Centre to have a disco would cost Â£25.00.Ingleton Community Centre has a library with photos of old Ingleton and old books and drawings but the library isn't used much.The Community Centre is used for all sorts of things like playgroup for the over 3s and toddlers for the under 3s.There is a typewriting class for people who want to learn how to type,and there is a youth club for 10s and over and there is a computer club for grown ups. There is a Scottish Dancing class for juniors.There is a painting class for the over 15s.The centre is open daily from 10am to 5pm.
